message:
Ruby vs Python, Which one do you recommend for an e-commerce project?
Considering the current frameworks ROR and Django for example

data.message: I think the interpreted languages war is over (pretty much all languages wars were over about a decade ago but that's a whole other story). The language itself doesn't really matter if you'll end up using a framework anyway so the comparison should be between frameworks not languages. I'm biased towards Python so I'll tell you to use python/Django for the blah blah blah blah reasons, another member of the group is a "code artisan :P" who likes Ruby will give you a different set of reasons to go for RoR. That's all crap IMHO, What you should do is layout a basic system architecture based on your business goals and then match this system to the most appropriate environment, you might surprise yourself at the end and use a completely different approach other than both.
عندي اعتقاد موش عارف صح ولا غلط. البايثون على المدى الطويل أفضل لخبرات ومهارات المطور اللي هيشتغل بيه.
Whichever one you feel better working with. Both will do the job equally well.
One thing I wouldn't recommend is NEVER use python for APIs on a big scale.

depend in your need you could use many language and many data structure in same project "like using java + python " and using cassndra + mysql + mongodb  every tool have a advantage and disadvantage Big boys like "Google , etc " do this even they invent tools for spacial cases < don't limit your self in one Box :-)

python with no doubts, eng Mohamed Alaa El Din said he does not recommend it, with all do respect, python could handle big projects if its constructed right, besides he is asking if he should use ruby or python.
